ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest10.de: Each &dArmor&r starts off at Tier 1. Upgrade to Tier 2 with two &bBlaze Rods&r in an &bEnchanting Apparatus&r, and Tier 3 with two &bEnder Pearls&r and one &bChorus Fruit&r in an &bEnchanting Apparatus&r. Each upgrade increases the amount of &dMana Regen&r and the number of &bAugmenting Threads&r an &dArmor&r can hold.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest11.de: Provides the least armor but supports the strongest &dAugmentation Threads&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest12.de: Provides more armor than the &dSorcerer's set&r and supports stronger &dAugmentation Threads&r than the &dBattlemage's set&r, but weaker threads than the &dSorcerer's&r and less armor than the &dBattlemage's&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest13.de: Provides the most Armor but supports the least powerful &dAugmentation Threads&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest13.su: Best Armor but least powerful Threads!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest14.de: &dMage Armor&r can be enhanced through &dMagical Threads&r. Each Armor has a level associated with it, and the strength of the applied &dThread's effect&r will be based on that level.
See the &eWorn Notebook - Magical Armor&r for more info.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest15.de: &bMycelial Sourcelinks&r generate &dSource&r when fueled with food on &bArcane Pedestals&r, &bArcane Platforms&r, or &bdropped nearby&r. Generates more &dSource&r if the food is a &dSource&r producing food.
Slowly converts the ground below it into &bMycelium&r and eventually causes &bMushrooms&r to grow.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest16.de: The &bVolcanic Sourcelink&r burns nearby fuel items (whether they be on &bArcane Pedestals&r, &bArcane Platforms&r, or are &bdropped items&r) to generate &dSource&r.
Turns nearby &bStone&r into &bMagma Blocks&r and eventually into &bLava&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest17.de: The &bVitalic Sourcelink&r generates &dSource&r whenever animals are bred near it or mobs are killed near it.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest17.su: Breed or Kill Mobs for Source!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest18.de: Absorbs &bPotions&r from nearby &bPotion Jars&r to generate &dSource&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest2.des: The &bImbuement Chamber&r absorbs passive &dSource&r from the environment to enhance the magical properties of various items.

One in particular, &bLapis Lazuli&r, act as a great conduit for source. By placing &bLapis Lazuli&r within an &bImbuement Chamber&r, &bSource Gems&r can be made. &bSource Gems&r are a crucial part of many magical tools.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest20.de: &bSplitters&r can input and output to multiple &bSource Jars&r.
&bCollectors&r automatically take &dSource&r from nearby &bSource Jars&r in a 5 block radius.
&bDepositers&r can automatically deposit &dSource&r into &bSource Jars&r within a 5 block radius.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest21.de: &bWarpers&r act the same way as &bSplitters&r but can go over infinite blocks. Beyond 30 blocks, there is a chance for &dSource&r loss.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest22.de: The &bRitual Brazier&r allows a mage to conduct various Rituals. Rituals can be modified by throwing in certain items.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest23.de: &bImbuement Chambers&r and &bEnchanting Apparatus&r can use nearby items to influence what they produce. &bArcane Pedestals&r act as a way to both display items and provide items to modify the properties of &dImbuing&r and &dEnchanting Rituals&r.
They need to be within 3 blocks of the &bImbuement Chamber&r or the &bEnchantment Apparatus&r to have effect.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest24.de: A Wand of Dominion allows a mage to control their familiars.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest3.des: &dSource&r is required to fuel many arcane machines. However, before you learn how to gather it, you need to create a place to store it.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest30.de: The &bScribe's Table&r allows a Mage to research and &6unlock new Spell Glyphs&r. Interact ('&5Right-Click&r') with the &bScribe's Table&r while holding a &bSpellbook&r to bring up the Menu.

Research new spells by selecting the spell of interest (&5'Select&r&5' button in the bottom right-hand corner&r) and providing the &bScribe's Table&r with the requested items. Use the &bSpell Glyph&r to learn the effect.
A &bNovice Spellbook&r can only use &dTier 1 Glyphs&r. To view all available &dTier 1 Glyphs&r, press the '&5I&r' section in the &bScribe's Table&r.
Each &dGlyph&r unlocked increases your &dSource Pool&r by a little.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest4.des: &bArgonomic Sourcelinks&r generate &dSource&r when nearby crops grow.
&bSource Jars&r must be within 5 blocks of the &bAgronomic Sourcelink&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest5.des: An &bEnchanting Apparatus&r allows one to make all sorts of refined magical equipment. Simply put in the item you are modifying, surround the Apparatus with the appropriate items on the surrounding &bArcane Pedestals&r, and supply enough &dSource&r.
&bEnchanting Apparatus&r can also be used to create the specific &bEnchanted Books&r that you want. Just provide the right catalysts.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest6.des: Item transport + Autoharvest source berries. Can be dyed
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest7.des: A &bMage's Spellbook&r allows one to use &dTier 2 Glyphs&r in their spell creation.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest8.des: An &bArchmage's Spellbook&r allows one to use the highest tier of &dGlyph&r, the &dTier 3 Glyphs&r, in their spell creation.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest9.des: &dSource&r powers everything in this world, though it takes many forms. &bSource Gems&r with the right materials augmenting an &dImbuement Ritual&r allow a mage to isolate and capture essences related to certain natural phenomena.

Rumor has it that originally an &5Eye of Ender&r was used as the foundation for all of &dMagic&r as we know it. Perhaps some of that power still lingers among the &dMagical Essences&r we see here today...
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quest9.sub: Create the Essences of the World!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.title: Ars Nouveau
ftbquests.chapter.collections.quest1.sub: Obtain every unique weapon. Good luck...
ftbquests.chapter.collections.quest10.su: Harness the power of mobs for powerful weapons
ftbquests.chapter.collections.title: Collections
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1.descript: There are a lot of things you can do with &bAndesite&r. &eCreate&r your first &bAndesite Casings&r to get the tools needed to build all sorts of fancy machines.
&6Create an Andesite Casing by applying some Andesite Alloy to a Stripped Log.&r
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1.subtitle: Start here to learn Create!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1.title: Beginnings of Create!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest10.descrip: If you place water, lava, or a campfire in front of this baby, it will cause the air to be filled with &ointeresting&r particles which can be used to process items! It also moves entities! Now you can have the air conditioning of your dreams...
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest10.subtitl: Don't stick your finger between the slats!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest10.title: I'm such a fan!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest11.descrip: Chopping down trees with your axe can get really boring really quickly. A saw can be used to fell it all at once! Just point the spinny edge at the bottom log and the entire thing will fall down! It can also be used for processing.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest11.subtitl: There's a buzzsaw in every game now isn't there?
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest11.title: Timbeeer!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest12.descrip: Rotation is not only useful for processing things, it's also useful for making things look nice! You can make large things rotate to add spice to your build, or even rotate something slightly and keep it locked at that rotation!
&6Edit the placement mode of a mechanical bearing by looking at the side of it.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest12.title: *Aesthetics :D*
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest13.descrip: &bCopper&r is not only useful for decoration, it can also be used to make methods of transporting fluids! When a &bBucket&r won't cut it, &bpipes&r can transport larger amounts of liquid.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest13.title: Manipulating Fluids
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest14.descrip: There's much that can be done with the Create mod, however in order to do anything you first need some form of power! All contraptions in the Create mod are powered by &erotational forces&r, and while there are indeed more complex methods of power generation, every good engineer starts off with either &bwind power&r, &9water power&r, or &6manual labor&r!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest15.descrip: There's much more to be seen! Much of Create is under the domain of pure precision, but quite a bit of it is supceptible to chaos. However you want to play it is completely up to you!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest15.subtitl: More and more and more accurate...
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest15.title: Precision!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest16.descrip: Feeling lost? Most machines from the create mod can be pondered by holding &ew&r while hovering over it in the inventory. Try it out if you don't fully understand how to use it!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2.descript: Engineers Goggles allow you to see the &aStress Units&r of the various contraptions you build.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2.subtitle: Determine Stress Units of your builds!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2.title: I see everything now
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3.descript: Wrenches allow you to easily rotate your contraptions. They are also used to pick up contraptions (&6Shift + Right Click&r).
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3.subtitle: Easily rotate and move your builds!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3.title: Comically large Wrench
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4.descript: Crush your first materials! You can operate the &bMechanical Press&r with your &bHand Crank&r, though you'll have to put your back into it.
Alternatively, you can hook it up to some &bWaterwheels&r or &bSails&r and harness the rotational force those generate to move the Press for you.
&ePlace the item being pressed below the Mechanical Press to process it.&r Use the Ponder Mechanic in JEI for more details (hover over the item and press "W")
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4.subtitle: Press Iron to obtain your first Iron Sheets!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4.title: Pressing Materials
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5.descript: Water is never to be underestimated. It erodes away canyons, shapes cliffsides, and washes away everything in terrifying floods. However, in moderation, it can be harnessed for one's own benifit. &9Waterwheels&r are the perfect example of how a stream of water can be transformed into rotational force.

&6Place a stream of water flowing through the blades of a waterwheel to spin it. It doesn't matter how many faces of the waterwheel is being touched by the flowing water, just one face is enough to fully power the waterwheel.&r
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5.subtitle: Sploosh
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5.title: Harnessing the rivers
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6.descript: Wind is everywhere. It is an ever present companion, whether you are sailing the seas, in a valley, or at the top of a mountain. It blows through forests and ruffles plains with it's jovial touch. It is constantly moving, and has no qualms blowing over whatever it wishes. With a bit of ingenuity, it is possible to fashion &bblades&r that catch it, and turns in response to it's constant playing.
&6Use any kind of wool attatched to a windmill bearing to harness the wind! It does have to be large enought to actually catch it though.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6.subtitle: Woosh
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6.title: Air power
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7.descript: If you just need a bit of rotation, you can provide it yourself! A &6handcrank&r is certainy very cheap, but it takes your energy to generate rotation. Go ahead and try it, but don't tire yourself out!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7.subtitle: Oh my aching back!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7.title: Blood, sweat, and tears
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8.descript: Sometimes just a regular crafting table doesn't cut it. You need something bigger and more mechanical! Now presenting the mechanical crafter 9000! When you chain multiple of these machines together, you can automate the crafting of items or even make things you could never make before using just the regular crafting table!

&8&o&kThe Mechanical Villager&r &8&oIndustries is not liable in any way, shape, or form for any misuse, malpractice, workplace injuries, or random speaking of french that may arise from using this product. Use at your own risk!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8.subtitle: More and more complex machines.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8.title: Mechanical Crafting
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest9.descript: Sometimes, you just want to crush things, you know? Using two crushing wheels, you are able to process things into more particulate versions of themselves. Go ahead and throw anything you want into it! We're not liable. :)
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest9.subtitle: Scrunch
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest9.title: Crushing Wheel
ftbquests.chapter.create.title: Create
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest1.descr: A &bHepheastus Forge&r is a tool of incredible power. Ponder by holding W on the Hepheastus Forge item to see how to create it.
To use its power, you need to feed it with &6Souls&r, &6Blood&r, &6Experience&r, and &6Aureal&r essence. Lists of what items work are on the last few pages.
You can use it to create &dRunic Weapons&r, &dItem Modifiers&r, and even some &dSecret Weapons&r.

While it is only &dTier 1&r initially, you can upgrade it to unlock more recipes and increase storage. Each upgrade will also give you an additional slot for an &6Enhancer&r. These help reduce the costs of essences and unlock new recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest1.title: The Hephaestus Forge
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest10.desc: The &dAlluring&r ritual is a rather simple ritual that &dlures&r all &epassive mobs&r in a large radius towards the &bBrazier&r the ritual is initaited in. Check &dEMI&r for instructions.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest11.desc: The &dRepeling&r ritual is another simple ritual that &drepels&r all &ehostile creatures&r in a large radius, pushing away from the &bBrazier&r the ritual is initaited in. Check &dEMI&r for instructions.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest12.desc: The &dDeceit&r ritual is a simple ritual that &nresets any negative standing&r you have with &bvillagers.&r In your journey through &4The Dark Arts&r- one may have to do some things they're not too proud of- but it'll be forgiven with this simple trick.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest13.desc: The &dRitual of Daylight&r and the &dRitual of Moonlight&r are 2 rituals that can be used to change the time of day- to &eDay&r and &1Night&r respectively.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest13.subt: Let there be Day! and Night!
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest14.desc: The &dRitual of Purifying&r is a simple ritual that can be used to maximize efficiency of &aVillager Curing.&r It cures ALL &6zombie villagers&r in a radius around the &bBrazier&r, while also restoring &6Zombified Piglins and Hoglins&r.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest15.desc: The &dSanguine Rituals&r are a series of &dRituals&r that grant the caster with 2 useful items; the &cSanguine Amulet&r and the &cSword of Sapping.&r Both of these rituals require living creatures around the &bBrazier&r as sacrifice- which will be &4consumed&r during the ritual.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest16.desc: The &dRecharging Rituals&r are used to charge the &6Soulfire and Bonechill wands&r, using &6Blaze Powder and Snowballs&r respectively. To charge, simply perform the appropriate ritual with your &6Wand&r on the &bNecrotic Focus.&r
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest17.desc: The &dCapturing Ritual&r is a unique ritual that captures any &6Undead Creatures&r around the &bBrazier&r &e(that are weakened to least a third of their total health)&r and places them in the &6Summoning Staff&r placed in the &bNecrotic Focus. &r
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest18.desc: You may assemble your own &dPumpkin Spirit&r similiarly to building a snow golem. Place 2 &6dark oak logs&r, then a &6hay bale&r on top, and lastly a &6pumpkin&r on top of that. Bring it to life by right clicking on the pumpkin with an &6Ethereal Spirit!&r
&4Who knows what using a transmuting elixir on the spirit may bring to life...&r
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest18.subt: Build your very own Pumpkin Spirit!
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest2.descr: The &bHepheastus Forge&r has up to 4 slots for &6Enhancers&r. They are found in structures throughout the world. Obtain all of them to unlock the full potential of the forge.
On the next page is a list of what each &6Enhancer&r does.
-&bUnholy Symbol&r: Allows for the creation of &dCelestial&r Items.
-&bHoly Symbol&r: Allows for the creation of &dCursed&r Items.
-&bRunic Tablet&r: Allows for the creation of &dRunic&r Items.
-&bElementarium&r: Allows for the creation of &dElemental&r Items.
-&bCrescent Moon&r: Greatly reduces &6Aureal&r usage depending on the time of day.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest2.title: Forge Enhancers
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest3.descr: You can create powerful &dItem Modifiers&r using the &bHepheastus Forge&r.
These can be applied to tools in a smithing table with an &bItem Modifier Upgrade Template&r.
A list of what each &dItem Modifier&r does is on the following page.
-&bSmelter Prism&r: Used on pickaxes. Gives it the ability to &dAuto-Smelt&r blocks it mines.
-&bSea Prism&r: Used on helmets. While worn grants &dregeneration&r and &dfaster mining&r while underwater.
-&bTerrastomp Prism&r: Used on tools that break blocks. Gives it the ability to &dvein-mine&r in a &d3x3&r area.
-&bWhirlwind Prism&r: Currently not implemented. You can place it to grant yourself &dslow-falling&r and propel yourself upwards.
-&bEternal Stella&r: Makes a tool or armor piece &dIndestrucible&r. It no longer has a durability bar.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest3.title: Item Modifiers
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest4.descr: The &bMystical Dagger&r allows you to fill a &bTest Tube&r with &4blood&r by killing mobs.
This can be used to fuel the &6Hephaestus Forge.&r
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest5.descr: &e&oSo? You think you have what it takes to be a Witch? We shall see.&r&r

To start your journey into Witchcraft you must obtain the &bBook of Shadows&r. It is your trusty book of &5the dark arts&r and will guide you through your journey. Place it on an &bAltar&r to unlock its power.
Also, every good Witch needs their very own &bMixing Cauldron&r.
&o&5Once you have these tools, your true test will begin.&r&r
Note: The Book of Shadows has been modified for this pack to have updated recipes so you can trust it!
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest5.title: Witchy Business
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest6.descr: If you wear a &bWitch's hat&r you can &6haggle&r with Witches. Bring them the items they ask for and you will be rewarded.
&o&5If you're lucky, you may even be able to obtain the Witch's Eye.&r&r
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest6.title: Witch Haggling
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest7.descr: Dark Rituals are a powerful alternative to Rituals, performed primarily using a &bBrazier&r surrounded by &bStone Hands&r and a &bNecrotic Focus&r.
&eItems can be placed in each of these receptacles to perform a number of different unique functions.&r
You can view the list of performable Rituals by checking the uses for the &bBrazier&r in &6EMI.&r
The item placed in the centre is placed in the &bbrazier&r, those surrounding it in &bstone hands&r and those surrounding it with a unique border is the &bnecrotic focus.&r
Once all items are in place, ignite the &bBrazier&r with a &6Flint and Steel&r to initiate the rirtual.
&eWhere the surrounding receptacles and the items contained inside of them are placed is not specific.&r
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest7.subti: Understand the Basics of Dark Rituals
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest7.title: The Dark Rituals
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest8.descr: The Crystallization Ritual is performed by placing &6Arcane Bonemeal&r in a &bBrazier&r and &6Redstone&r in 2 surrounding &bStone Hands&r.
This ritual converts all nearby &6Undead Creatures&r into &6Soul Shards,&r a very useful crafting component in &4The Dark Arts&r.
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest8.title: Crystallization Ritual
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest9.descr: The &dLesser Summoing&r rituals are a series of rituals using &6Charcoal&r in a &bBrazier&r surroung by&6 various utility items&r in &bStone Hands&r and the &bNecrotic Focus.&r
This ritual summons various &6Undead Creatures&r atop the &bbrazier&r, with each combination summoning a different type. Use &dEMI&r to see the specifics of each &4Ritual Recipe.&r
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.quest9.title: Lesser Summoning Rituals
ftbquests.chapter.dark_arts.title: The Dark Arts
Trade &bSource Gems&r for &bPathfinder Quills&r to locate different biomes!
ftbquests.chapter.explorers_maps.title: Explorers Maps
ftbquests.chapter.pack_introduction.ques: &5Integrated Minecraft &6is a modpack centered around integrating various popular mods together for a cohesive experience.&r This questbook is set up to help guide you through some of the larger mods as well as to point you towards things of interest. Keep reading for more info!

You'll also notice that the sections outside of this one are written with some lore. Feel free to delve into it, but if not your cup of tea, the &6Subtitles&r should give you a quick overview of each section.
Start here!
Welcome to Integrated Minecraft!

Some mobs have information attached to their Spawn Eggs. These usually are mobs with more complicated mechanics. Additional information and lore for many mobs can be found through the &6Animal Dictionary&r.
&nExample:&r
Gorilla
Elephant
Bee
Search Mobs
You can also search for specific mods with &a"@"&r. For instance, try &a"@endrem"&r. If you are enjoying items from a specific mod, try looking it up to see what else it has to offer!
&nExamples: &r
@AlexsMobs
@Spelunkery
@Create
Search by Mod ID
The pathway to the &5End&r has been completely reworked through &e"End Remastered"&r. View it under "&aTo the End of the Beginning&r"!
Eyes of Ender Tweaks

As you begin your first adventure, you stumble upon a worn, tattered book labeled 「Adventuring for Newbies!!!!」.  &a"What an insane coincidence"&r, you think. Intrigued, you open it up, and surprisingly, a crude looking face and words start appearing on the page.
「Oh. Hmm. I can see you're trying to speak but I can't actually hear you. Heck, it's already taking an immense amount of power to manifest like this. Hence these cruddy faces.」&e(>_<)&r
「But, decision time. Help me or abandon me.」
「Just the person I was expecting. Say, would you like to slay a Dragon?」&eヽ(•‿•)ノ&r
Flabbergasted, you almost drop the book. But you can't.
「How. Rude. But hey, beggers can't be choosers, I guess.」&e┐(￣ヘ￣)┌&r
You try to close the book. But you can't.
「Cmon, just hear me out. Then I'll let you go.」&e╥﹏╥&r

「Thanks. Help me achieve my goals and I'll help you achieve yours. &aMy name is Ana, a Mage&r. I was sealed in this book, but once I'm out, I'll grant you all the riches you could ever want. Heck, I can even manifest a few things from within here for you.」
You try to ask for more details.
Premise of the Lore
Pack Lore Flavoring
Lore Introduction
COMPLETE TO ENABLE LORE (subquests that only give flavor text)
Help?
Abandon?

Links
Details and flavorful descriptions of all the mobs from &6"Alex's Mobs"&r!
Click to get the Animal Dictionary!
Animal Dictionary
Obtain the Chronicle of Shadows from &e"Apotheosis"&r. Contains details on Enchanting changes, Potion changes, and Villager changes.
More details on Enchanting changes from Apotheosis!
Chronicle of Shadows
&e"JEI"&r (short for Just Enough Items) and &e"EMI"&r are the items on the right when you open your inventory. Use them to search items and view their recipes. Here's a couple of tricks!

- Press &d"R"&r over an item, or &dleft-click&r on it, to view its recipe. Some items like Rotten Flesh will display the mob they are dropped by. Some items will have a tab with an &a"I"&r in a circle. Click it to view more information on the item
- Press &d"U"&r over an item, or &dright-click&r on it, to view its uses in various recipes.
Learn to use JEI/EMI to search items!
Learn to use JEI
JEI/EMI!
Complete to recieve the Worn Notebook, which contains the full documentation for Ars Nouveau.
Detailed documentation on Ars Nouveau!
Ars Nouveau Documentation
Worn Notebook (Ars Nouveau)

&bExplorer Maps&r are a core part of the &5Integrated Minecraft&r experience, acting as an expansion of the mapping functionalities provided by the base game. Many of you already know how to use a Map, but here's a quick reference for anyone who's forgotten.

- The top of the map is &6North&r, and travelling in the &6negative Z direction&r takes you North. The red pole of the &bMagnetic Compass&r also points North, so if it is pointing upwards, you are travelling North.
- Left of the map is &6West&r, and travelling in the &6negative X direction&r takes you West. The &bMagentic compass&r will be pointing right.
- Right of the map is &6East&r, and travelling in the &6positive X direction&r takes you East. The &bMagentic compass&r will be pointing left.
- The bottom of the map is &6South&r, and travelling in the &6positive Z direction&r takes you South. The &bMagentic compass&r will be pointing down.
F3 will show the direction you are headed if you ever get confused.
Quick refresher on how Explorer Maps work!
Using Maps
Tips

&e"Regions Unexplored"&r adds many biomes, including some with their own types of &bdirt&r. While there is an option to limit biome generation to only include default dirt, in order to allow for greater customization, this is not enabled by default.
However, to ease inventory management issues, all new dirt types can be converted to vanilla &bdirt&r through the &bCrafting Table&r. Try it out!
Many can also be crafted through custom recipes (mostly involving their respective saplings).
Easy Conversions for Inventory Management!
Dirt Conversions
- The inventory is greatly improved through the &e"Inventorio"&r and &e"Tool Belt"&r mods!
- You now have multiple offhands! This is now called the &bUtility Belt&r. You can scroll through them with a keybind (default &5"Button 4"&r).
- You can now equip a &bTool Belt&r through the curios menu. Press &5"G"&r to access it. You can add more slots to your &bTool Belt&r with &bBelt Pouches&r with an &bAnvil&r.
- There is a new leggings enchantment called &bDeep Pockets&r. Each level adds &6an additional row&r to your inventory. Additionally, the first level adds 4 extra slots to the &bUtility Belt&r.
- The capacity for the &bEnder Chest&r has been doubled.
- An &bInfinity Bow&r no longer requires arrows.
- &bTotems&r activate from the &bUtility Belt&r.
Inventorio
Inventory Tweaks
Since you're here, you probably understand the basics of the &dQuest Book&r. However, in case you are new to this, here's some important things to keep in mind:
- The tab on the left shows all of the &bChapters&r within the &dQuest Book&r.
- &bSome chapters and many quests are initially hidden, until they are trigger by certain items&r. These should pop-up on the right of the screen when trigger.
- One chapter acts as a storage for &dhidden recipes&r, unlocked by finding &7Tattered Books&r.
Learn how the Quest Book works!
&5&nWhat should I do?&r&r

Normal Minecraft stuff :) This pack has tools to help you explore and add a more RPG element, but at the end of the day, its meant as an open ended vanilla expansion. Maybe try getting the Eyes of Ender?
&5&nHow do I craft x?&r&r

Many of the recipe books are intentionally left ambiguous with the intent that players puzzle it out on their own. That said, we know not everyone likes that approach. Thus, each quest book SHOULD trigger a Quest containing the exact recipes.
&5&nCan you add x mod?&r&r

As a general rule of thumb, it's better to have less mods than more, as if we discover any game-breaking bugs, removing mods can break player's worlds. That said, we highly highly encourage you to customize the pack to your wants and needs. To do this, in CurseForge, go to the dots next to &6"Play"&r, hit &6"Profile Options"&r, and click &6"Allow Content Management for this Profile"&r. Most mods should be compatible out of the box. &eALWAYS BACKUP YOUR PACK BEFORE ADDING, REMOVING, OR UPDATING MODS.&r
&5&nI don't like x mod.&r&r

The hard part about this pack is many of the features are so integrated that it's hard to untangle them. That said, many are highly configured (looking at you, Apotheosis...) to smooth some of the rougher corners. I'm willing to help you remove mods if you ask in Discord (besides Ars Nouveau, Create, and a few others. Those are bedrock of the pack unfortunately)

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask on Discord! Craisin or I (hisakid) are usually around to answer questions. I have the Integrated Minecraft channel unmuted so I should see most chats.

&5Integrated Minecraft&r includes a couple of tweaks to Vanilla mechanics. Check them out here!
Vanilla Tweaks!
Vanilla Tweaks

- Villagers have completely reworked trades to integrate the various mods. Higher tiered villagers also have some special rewards. All of these changes were made through &e"Dynamic Villager Trades"&r.
- Villagers now follow players holding &2Emerald Blocks&r, courtesy of &e"Quark"&r.
- Villagers now cycle their trades every day.
- Only &lmax level&r librarians sell &bMending&r, but they are more likely to sell &bMending&r. There may be other ways to obtain it too...
- There are three new villager types through &e"Ice and Fire"&r, &e"Domestication Innovation"&r, and &e"Better Archeology"&r. Search &2#villager_job_site&r to view their job blocks.
Villager Mechanics
- Enchanting has been overhauled through &e"Apotheosis"&r. Upgrade your enchanting set up with higher tier bookshelves to get better results!

- The EXP needed for max-level enchanting (through Apotheosis) has been greatly increased. However, now &670% of your EXP is dropped on death and the EXP scaling between levels has been greatly reduced&r.
- &6Enchantment books found in chests are now limited in level&r to encourage enchanting through the &bEnchanting Table&r. They can still be upgraded in &bAnvils&r (see Anvil tweaks).
Enchantment Tweaks
Enchanting and EXP Tweaks

- &bAnvils&r &6no longer have penalties for prior work&r to reduce the need for EXP grinders and encourage a gradual progression of tool improvement, rather than applying all the enchantments at once.
- &bAnvils&r can now be repaired by right-clicking with &bIron Ingots&r
- Renaming items only needs 1 level of EXP.
All of these changes have been done through &e"Forgery"&r!
Anvil Tweaks
- Combat is improved through the &e"Better Combat"&r mod. Try it for yourself!
- There are multiple new types of weapons. Each has different combat properties, so try several.

- &bShields&r have been reworked through the &e"Shield Expansion"&r mod. &bShields&r are now disabled upon being hit, but if you time your block right when attacked (parry), the cooldown is bypassed and melee attackers are pushed back.
Miscellaneous Tweaks
Combat Tweaks
This pack comes with a lot of keybinds built in. Here are some of key ones:
- &d"I"&r - Inventory Settings Menu (&eInventorio&r).
- &d"Z"&r - Uses a Spyglass in your Inventory (&eSpyglass Improvements&r).
&a&lYou might want to add a keybind to:&r&r
- Switch hotbars (&eQuark&r). Search it at "Hotbar Swapper" under Keybinds.
- Switch utilities (&eInventorio&r). This scrolls through your offhand slot. Search it at "Utility" under Keybinds.
- Enables Rotation Lock (&eQuark&r), allowing for placing blocks only in a certain orientation. Search it at "Rotation Lock".
If you have any questions on how to control something, check the Key Binds!
Some items with specific keybinds (ie. &bQuiver&r, &bMap Atlas&r) have additional information on them in their JEI Information tab.
- &d"B"&r - Open Backpack (&eSophisticated Backpacks&r)
- &d"C"&r - Open Spellbook (&eArs Nouveau&r)
- &d"G"&r - Open Tool Belt (&eTool Belt&r)
- &d"Button 4"&r - Cycles through Utility Belt (&eInventorio&r)
- &d"M"&r - Open Map Atlas (&eMap Atlas&r)
- &d"Y"&r - Crawl (&eForgery&r)
- &d"V"&r - Opens Voice Chat GUI (&eSimple Voice Chat&r).
- &d"U"&r - Mute Microphone (&eSimple Voice Chat&r)
All current keybinds of note!
Keybinds

&b"Perfect! Since some of our &6Quests&r&b require &5Guildmembers&r&b to slay monsters deep in the caves, the &5Contract&r&b acts as a means of verifying the completion of those &6Quests&r&b without requiring the &5Guildmembers&r&b to fork over some of the spoils."

ftbquests.chapter.secret_recipes.title: Secret Recipes
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest1.descripti: Backpacks are a great way to carry more goods. Equip them to your back and open them with &d"B"&r.
They also have a ton of special &bUpgrades&r. Experiment with the ones you like best!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest1.subtitle: Expand your inventory!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest10.descript: &aKnives&r are versatile tools that can be used as weapons, to harvest straw from grass and to obtain extra materials from animals. When used with a &acutting board&r you can really get the most out of your fauna and flora!
- &dRight-click&r with an item in your hand to place it on the cutting board
- Equip your knife, &dright-click&r on the cutting board and see what happens!
Knives aren't the only tool that can be used on the cutting board. Try looking up its uses (&dHover + Press U&r) to see what you can make.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest10.subtitle: Process your foods!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest11.descript: &bCages&r can capture animals that are small enough. May be helpful in starting a farm!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest11.subtitle: Capture Mobs!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest12.descript: A &bTrowel&r randomly places blocks from your hotbar when used.
An &bAbacus&r can be used to count the number of blocks between the block you right clicked and the block you are looking at, up to 48 blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest12.subtitle: Tools to aid in Building!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest12.title: Building Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest13.descript: This land is full of delicious ingredients just waiting to be turned into culinary delights. Don't settle for boring baked potatoes when you can use the &bCooking Pot&r to make bigger, hearty meals. However, you'll need to &aheat&r the pot somehow and may even need some type of &akitchenware to hold your freshly cooked food.&r
Try as many different foods as you can, it might even make you &astronger&r!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest14.descript: &bNourishing&r food prevent players from losing &bHunger Points&r or &bSaturation&r from sources other than regenerating health for as long as the effect is active!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest14.subtitle: Eat a food that grants Nourishing!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest14.title: Nourishing!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest15.descript: &bComforting&r foods prevent the player from being affected by &bSlowness&r, &bWeakness&r, or &bHunger&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest15.subtitle: Eat a food that provides Comforting!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest15.title: Comforting!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest16.descript: &bFeeding Troughs&r are storage blocks that animals will automatically eat from. &6With enough food, animals may breed on their own!&r
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest16.subtitle: Automatically feed animals!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest17.descript: As you taste different foods, you'll unlock more hearts! After &6the first 50 different foods&r to get your first bonus heart, &6every 25 different foods&r will unlock another heart. The &eSpice of Life: Carrot Edition&r &bFood Book&r will track your progress. Try to eat everything this pack offers!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest17.subtitle: Track the foods you've eaten!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest18.descript: &bStorage Drawers&r allow players to store many items in one block. Additionally, &6they can hold many upgrades&r to greatly increase storage capacity.
- &d"Shift + Right Click"&r to deposit an entire stack of items.
- &d"Shift + Right Click"&r to retrieve an entire stack of items.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest18.subtitle: Compound Storage!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest18.title: Storage Drawers
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest19.descript: &bDrawer Controllers&r allow multiple &bStorage Drawers&r to be connected together. Depositing items here will deposit them into the correlating &bStorage Drawer&r, as long as they are connected by other Storage Drawers or &bController Extenders&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest19.subtitle: Connect multiple Drawers!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest2.descripti: &bBounty Boards&r collect quests from anywhere, though the type are usually related to the &bDegree&r that they have. The &bDegrees&r that each Board has can be modified.
Complete the quests to earn rewards and to build up &5Reputation&r! As you become more &5Reputable&r, you may find that the Quests give better rewards or even new unique Rewards!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest2.subtitle: Recieve Quests and get Rewards!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest20.descript: &bUpgrade Templates&r serve as the base for any &bDrawer Upgrade&r you make. Upgrades can massively increase the storage of a &bStorage Drawer&r, but require &bMechanical Crafters&r (see '&5Create&r') to make.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest21.descript: &bWaystones&r are a great way to teleport between locations, for a small XP cost.
They can be difficult to craft though, requiring both Mechanical Crafters and the Enchanting Apparatus!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest21.subtitle: Teleportation!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest22.descript: You'll be doing lots of exploring in this pack. A &bBottle of Dimensional Tears&r is a quick way to warp back to your spawn (or base). Obtain one by using an &bEmpty Bottle&r on a block of &bCrying Obsidian&r or a filled &bRespawn Anchor&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest22.subtitle: Return home!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest23.descript: &bSpyglasses&r have been given some much needed improvements. They can be stored in the Belt Slot in your inventory and as long as you are carrying one, they can be accessed at anytime by pressing &d"Z"&r.
Additionally, you can scope further in or out with a mousewheel!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest23.subtitle: Zoom in!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest24.descript: &bBedrolls&r let you sleep without setting your spawnpoint!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest24.subtitle: Sleep tight!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest25.descript: A &bHammer&r lets you customize your furniture to your heart's content!
Use on &bchairs&r to switch the back style, &bshelves&r and &bwooden pedestals&r to toggle item rotation, and &bcrates&r to prop them up/down.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest25.subtitle: Become a Carpenter!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest26.descript: The &bDragonseeker&r is a way to locate the power dragons of your world.

It can be right-clicked to produce a tone, which is slightly higher when it detects a dragon within 150 blocks. Be careful, though- it's not infallible, and might make a mistake! It'll also pick up on dead and tamed dragons, so be sure to clear out the area you're searching in beforehand. It can be upgraded to be more accurate and increase range!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest26.subtitle: Find a mighty Dragon
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest27.descript: &6Apothic Tomes&r are useful tools that can be used in place of &6Books&r in an &bEnchanting Table.&r They function similiarly to a book, but instead only recieve &dEnchantments&r for a specific piece of equipment.
Additionally, &6Tomes of Scrapping&r extract enchantments off of a piece of equipment, storing them as a &6book&r for later use.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest27.subtitle: Specifiy Enchantments
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest27.title: Apothic Tomes
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest28.descript: -&bStorage Terminals&r give you access to your inventories.
-&bInventory Connectors&r connect all touching inventories into a touching Storage Terminal.
-&bInventory Cables&r allow connecting storage over longer distances. You still need at least one inventory connector within the network.
-&bInventory Cable Connectors&r Allow connecting Inventory Cables to storage.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest28.subtitle: Storage Terminals
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest28.title: Storage Networking
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest29.descript: The &bWireless Terminal&r allows you to access a storage network from anywhere!
-Build a level 1 &5Beacon&r within 8 blocks to make it accessible from anywhere in the same dimension.
-Make it a level 4 &5Beacon&r for it to be accessible from anywhere! You will need to use &6Chunk Loaders&r to accomplish this.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest29.subtitle: Wireless Storage!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest29.title: The Digital Age
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest3.descripti: &bSacks&r are another way to carry more goods. &6However, having too many of them will weigh you down.&r Don't be too greedy!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest3.subtitle: Mini Shulker Boxes!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest30.descript: The &bCrafting Terminal&r allows you to craft directly in your storage terminal!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest30.subtitle: Crafting Terminal
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest30.title: Craft Away!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest4.descripti: A &bSaw&r can be used to quickly and effectively process wood, similar to a &bStonecutter&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest4.subtitle: Aids in wood processing!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest4.title: Sawmill

ftbquests.chapter.towards_the_end_of_the: The keys to the End have been scattered as 15 Eyes of Ender, all obtained through different ways. Only 12 are needed to open the End.
End Remastered

The &5Fragments of this Eyes&r was given to the &6Clerics&r of each Village for safekeeping and to fuel their magic. Though its true origin and power was forgotten, &6Clerics &eregularly infuse &5Vessels&r with &5Fragments&r of its power, creating more talismen that can tap into the original source.
&eHowever, only the most trusted are given this opportunity.&r
Obtained through trading with a Master level Cleric
The Temples lining the sea were once considered places of worship. To protect these Temples, the architects used the power of one of the original &5Eyes of Ender&r to create the Guardians.

While the power is too dilute to be noticed in most normal Guardians, those that have survived for a long time have enough concentrated energy to inflict curse on all who approach the Temple. &eOne can recollect &5Fragments of this Eye&r &eby pressing a &5Vessel&r &eto the eye of an &6Elder Guardian&e.&r
Obtain by combining Elder Eyes with Eyes of Ender!

At the height of her power, the Primordial Wizard shattered this &5Eye&r, spreading its &5Fragments&r throughout the land and laying the foundation for Magic as we know it. However, never knowing when she may once again need it, she left a way to tap into its power. &eBy combining the &6Essences of Magic&e, a &5Vessel&e could be filled and act as a conduit&r.
Though this was kept secret, those who study Magic would eventually discover this method, exploiting it for their own purposes...
Obtained through combining all the essences in the Enchanting Apparatus!

&5Fragments of this &5Eye&r were cast into the fires of the &4Nether&r. There, its hatred grew and grew. The souls in the soil around it responded to this hatred in kind, rising up with &7bones stained black&r.

&eShould enough of these bones be brought together and given form, perhaps one would be able to create a simulacrum of this Eye&r. Though, with such condensed power and more souls to manipulate, there's no telling what could happen.
Obtained through killing the Wither!
One of the factions responsible for sealing the &5Ender Dragon&r were the &6Witches of the Swamplands&r. Thus, they were given one of the &5Eyes&r to safeguard.

Sadly, it seems that overtime it corrupted them, causing them to view Villagers and other allies as horrendous monstrosities. The &5Eye&r was eventually fragmented and the original Witch Circle broke up into many sects.
&ePerhaps if one could gain a Witch's trust, they'd be able to obtain a fragment of this &5Eye&r. &eThough, one would have to find a way around the &5Eye's Corruption&r&e.
Obtained through Witch Haggling!

To ensure the continued existence of this &5Eye&r, its &5Fragments&r were imbued into the living. Unfortunately, its power was too great and as its initial bearers died, the power seeping from the &5Fragments&r brought them back to life.

While no more bearers are created, it is also impossible to truly destroy the current ones. They may vanish for a time, but they are always brought back. &eThough, brewing together some of their parts and providing an empty &5Vessel&r &ecan allow one to create a simulacrum of the original.
Obtained through cooking multiple Undead drops!
This &5Eye&r was fragmented shortly after the Ender Dragon was sealed. It permated the land, often pooling in areas commonly known to attract the attention of its inhabitants.
&eBy presenting a &5Vessel&r &ewith ample material from various rare biomes, one can obtain a &5Fragment of this Eye&r&e.
Obtained through crafting together many exotic items!
No one knows how, when, or where this Eye was shattered. &eThough, there have been reports of it showing up randomly once adventurers reach their goals.&r
Rarely obtained through Randomized Rewards!
As the &5Eyes&r provided a great source of power, merchants used &5Fragments of this Eye&r to power their ships. Yet, as with any relic of supreme power, there were those who sought to monopolize it.

The first known accounts of Pirates where those who would attack merchant ships, hoping to steal &5Fragments of the Eye&r for themselves. Worse yet, there were accounts of mutinies carried out on merchant ships as ploys for power were made.
&eThus, many of these &5Fragments &ewere sunk to the bottom of the sea, stored in &6Pirate caches&r&e, or otherwise might be found around the &6carcasses of pirate ships&r&e.
Found in Buried Treasure, Pirate Village, and Sunken Ships!
The original bearer of this &5Eye&r once used it to carve out a domain of his own. He covered his land with a snowstorm so vicious that it would freeze any who would dare to enter.

Though the bearer has long since past away, &ethe power of the &5Eye&r &estill permeates through the land, ocassionally concentrating deeply enough in some creatures to grant them abilities similar to the original bearer&r. Adventurers have colloquially termed these creatures &6Frostmaws&r. To this day, no one has been able to slay one...
Obtained through slaying the Frostmaw!

Among those who sealed the &5Ender Dragon&r, one had joined for his own purposes. He believed the power granted by the &5Eyes&r would allow him the power to drive those who opposed him to their knees.

As the Bearer exploited the Eye's power and as his own thoughts, feelings, and desires flowed into the &5Eye&r, the power within the &5Eye&r began taking on the Bearer's personality. In turn, using the &5Eye&r amplified everything the Bearer put into it, warping him beyond recognition. He became more violent, more ruthless, and more greedy. Overtime, the &5Eye&r fragmented, and its &5Fragments&r were passed down along the Bearer's lineage, leading to the creation of the &7Illagers&r. &eOnly &7Illager Royalty&r&e are privledged enough to obtain &5Fragments of this Eye&r&e, and they remain within the &5Illager Fortress&r&e, giving out orders across the land.&r
Found in the Illager Fortress!

&eAdventurers commonly treat the &5Fragments of this Eye&r &eas a commodity, a marker of status&r. Only the greatest Adventurers are granted the privledge of holding a fragment. All those who have been granted &5Fragments&r have gone on to become legends of their era. However, it is said that once those Bearers settle down and retire, their &5Fragment&r mysteriously vanishes. Thus, to keep the legends going, &eBearers have a tradition of passing it on to the next generation, though only to those with a certain &6Reputation&e.&r
However, to this day, no one has been able to truly tap into its power.
Obtained through the Bounty Board with a Reputation of greater than 15!

Just as the &5Cursed Eye&r was granted to the Pigkin for their aid in the sealing of the &5Ender Dragon&r, so to was the &5Nether Eye&r. For Millenia, this &5Eye&r remained intact, acting as a central pillar of the Pigkin community.

Yet, overtime, as expansion throughout the &4Nether&r continued, there were those who thought it'd be best to fragment this &5Eye&r, so its power could be applied in other places. This eventually became the majority sentiment, as so it was done. Expansion increased dramatically, and &eNether Fortresses&r sprung up everywhere, cementing the Pigkin as a dominant force. Yet, as all things do, things went wrong.

As the &5War of Hel and Stone&r began, the Fortresses became a center point of the battle and the &5Fragments of the Nether Eye&r were used. While a potent weapon, its true value lied in the enhancing properties it granted. Pigkin bearing the Eye grew taller, hit harder, and would overcome death itself.

Now knowing its power, the &4Pigkin of the Fortresses&r grew protective of their &5Fragments&r, even turning away other Pigkin, eventually resulting an a civil war between the two fractions. The &8Pigkin of the Bastions&r, now known as Piglins, were decimated and forced into hiding. Yet, those of the &4Fortress&r weren't unscathe too. Their excessive use of the &5Eye&r warped them beyond recognition. While their death defying capabilities were once a blessing, now they had become a curse, as their flesh decayed, taking their minds with it. Their only remaining thought was "Protect the &5Nether Eye&r".
Found in Nether Fortresses!

There was once a Pharaoh who sought immortality. In this pursuit, he eventually stumbled upon a &5Fragment of an Eye&r, buried amongst the sands. It appeared before him, as if to tempt him. Immediately recognizing the &5Eye&r as a relic of immense power, he immediately grabbed it. As he did, forbidden knowledge flowed into his head, whispering of other races in other worlds, of secrets, of immortality.

While he did eventually find a way to cheat death, it wasn't the true immortality he sought. And one day, his machinations caught up to him and he was killed permanently. &eEver since then, the &5Fragment of the Eye&r&e has lied dormant at his burial site...

&eSome speculate that the &5Fragments of this Eye&r&e and the insight it grants are the fuel behind the Deathworms that plague the Desert. As the fluid produced by killing Deathworms is well known for being involved in rituals of forsight.&r
Found in the Desert Labyrinth or Dropped by Large Deathworms!

&5The Tinker&r &eused the &5Fragments of this Eye&r &eto unlock a higher creative energy within themself&r. It is said it was originally used by ancient people to build advanced machines of immense redstone and rotational power.
Found in the Tinker's Workshop

&5The Pigkin&r &ehave protected &5Fragments of this Eye&r &efor generations&r. It is said they once used its power to extract many valuable resources from the nether and build their empire. The bastions are all that remain of the expansive control they had over the nether.
Obtained through Piglin Bartering and found in Bastions
To the End of the Beginning
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest1.descri: Can't have you dying on me so easily. Here, I'll cut you a deal. You survive long enough and I'll give you rewards.
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest1.title: Survival Skills I
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest10.descr: &bDeeds of Ownership&r allow you to transfer ownership of your pet to another player. Pet Tamer Villagers may have some for trade!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest10.subti: Grant ownership of your pet to another player!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest11.subti: You survived 100 days of Integrated Minecraft!! Now you can post your 100 days video
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest2.descri: Unfortunately, you died. Luckily, I could bring you back. However, all of your equipment is stored in a &aGravestone&r at your place of death.
Break it to get your items back!
You also have an &aobituary&r with the coordinates of your death.
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest2.title: Post-Mortem
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest3.descri: Doing pretty good I see! I imagine it must be pretty stressful, so here, have this totem, on me. Because I believe in you. Obviously.
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest3.title: Survival Skills II
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest4.descri: Wow. I'm genuinely impressed you made it this long. You deserve this.
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest5.descri: Some Animals are tameable. They can be great assets in combat or may provide other benefits. Invest enough time into them and they'll reward you!
&eSome new Animals are also tameable.&r Check the JEI Info attached to their spawn eggs to figure out if they are and how they are tamed.
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest5.title: Tame your First Pet!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest6.descri: There are many great tools you can use to care for your pets.
- &bPet Beds&r allow your pets to respawn.
- &bFeather on a Stick&r allows you to direct your pets.
- &bCommand Drums&r allow you to give mass orders to your pets.
- &bWayward Lanterns&r allow lost pets to find you.
Check the JEI info of each for more details!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest6.subtit: Tools to better care for your pet!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest6.title: Pet Supplies
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest7.descri: Trading with Villagers can be a great way to get some rare resources while helping them out.
Prove that you're a trustworthy source of aid for the Villages across the land and I'll grant you rewards.
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest7.subtit: Trade with Villagers and get rewards!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest7.title: Trading with Villagers I
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest8.descri: Great work! Here's a map to some other villages that we can help out. Additionally, if you'd like to visit a hub of commerce, here's a map to the Bazaar.
Many Villagers gather there so you may find some interesting Rumors there...
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest8.subtit: Trade with Villagers and get rewards!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest8.title: Trading with Villagers II
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest9.descri: Some of the Villagers seem to have taken a liking to you and are willing to join you, if you'd like to establish your own town. Take good care of them and I'm sure your town will attract many more Villagers.
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest9.subtit: Trade with Villagers to get rewarded!
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.quest9.title: Trading with Villagers III
ftbquests.chapter.tracking.title: Surviving this World
As you approach, a &eGuard&r calls out to you,
&b"Halt, Traveller. Our Fortress offers respite to you, but if you want to use our services, you must pay the tax. &6Six emeralds, and we'll do business with you.&r&b"&r
&b"If you'd like to enter, use the &6Crank Handle&r&b near the door."&r
You approach a Castle, its walls aged by time and the numerous scratches telling of many conflicts...
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest10: As you enter the Barracks in the morning, newly downed with &5Royal Armor&r, you notice several other similarly clad &eGuards&r. The &eCaptain&r briefly acknowledges you, before speaking out.

&b"Those &7Pillager Patrols&r&b are a perpetual pain in our behind. Take 'em out for us. Don't lead them back to the &5Castle&r&b though. I've seen my fair share of &7Raids&r&b in my time, and I can tell you now, you aren't prepared."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest11: As you move to leave the Barracks, the &5Captain&r pulls you aside.

&b"Listen. I know this is unfair of me to ask, but if you see any &7Vindicators&b, slay them for me. They've been more active recently and I know many &6Villagers&b have been taken from their homes for whatever nefarious purposes the &7Illagers&b have."&r
&b"They don't normally show up around our territories, but since you're a traveller, keep an eye out."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest12: A grizzled Adventurer waves you over.
&b"You look pretty strong. Maybe you can fulfill some of my regrets.&r

&b"I know of a vault in the desert filled with powerful loot. However, it is cursed. &6Blocks can't be broken within its walls&b, and its creator, the &5Undying Pharaoh&b, &6filled it with traps&b."&r

&b"I've heard, though, that the same vault ended up being his own grave. He made enemies with the wrong people, and while they couldn't outright kill him, they sent an &6assassin who could turn others to stone with a mere gaze&b."
&b"I'm too old to attempt it myself, but I'm sure someone like you could do it. Prove your worth to me and I'll give you the location of the vault."&r
Complete to recieve the map to the Labyrinth
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest13: As you enter the Bazaar, you are overwhelmed by immense amounts of people swarming around. Villagers from all works of life lively call out their various products and services.
A couple of people catch your eye...
Find the Bazaar to Unlock more Rumors
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest15: As you enter &5the Oasis&r, a couple of &eVillagers&r greet you while others stare at you distrustfully.
Resources are scarce and a &5wanderer&r like you is just another mouth to feed. &6Perhaps if you can prove your worth, you may be more welcomed.&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest16: As you enter the &5Bazaar&r, a merchant waves you over.
&b"Looks like you are pretty stocked up on food and water. If you're willing to give me some, &6I'll pay you handsomely. Either that or you can have some of my stock."&r

&b"Heck, if you're willing to send even more food and water to us in the future, &6I'd be more than happy to provide you with even more supplies&r&b. I think we could be great business partners. How does that sound?"&r
Grant inhabitants of the Desert food in return for Supplies (2 sets of items are required per trade)
Trade: 2x Desert Supplies for Desert Loot
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest17: As you look up, you are astounded to see huge, mechanical airships. You scramble to pillar up, and as you near the ship, you hear the Villagers onboard call out.
&b"Ahoy &5Wanderer&r&b! Come aboard. We have wares from across the lands, surely you'll find something of your taste!"&r
As you walk, a large shadow covers over you...
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest18: Near the bow of the ship, a woman leans over with a &eSpyglass&r in hand. As you approach, the wood of the deck creaks underfoot, startling the woman, causing her to drop her &eSpyglass&r.
&b"Heavens above, you can't go wandering up on people like that. Now what in the 4 Realms are we to do now. &dI NEEDED that Spyglass&r&b to navigate."&r
&b"Of course this happens now, of all times. I just used by last &eSpectre Flare&r&b too..."&r
A woman peers over the ship's bow...
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest19: You hand the woman the &eSpyglass&r and the &eSpectre Flares&r.

&b"Oh. Thanks! I didn't expect you to do that. Maybe you aren't so bad after all. Oh, I guess I should properly introduce myself. You can call me &5Salay&r&b. I'm the &5Crow's Nest's&r&b Helmswoman."&r

&b"I know the &eSpyglass&r&b was a replacement for the one you dropped, but these &eSpectre Flares&r&b are especially nice. One of my hobbies is raising &6Spectres&r&b. They are adorable, but also very useful. Did you know a &eSpectre Flare&r&b, when broken, will briefly let you see through the &6Spectre's&r&b eyes? Not only that, but if you present a &6Spectre&r&b with an &eAllurite Shard&r&b and then &eSpyglass&r&b, they'll link to it and using the &eSpyglass&r&b will let you see through the &6Spectre's&r&b eyes."&r

&b"It's a bummer. The plague recently sweep through my last batch. And who knows when we'll find another &aLichen Cavern&r&b. If I had some &eSpectres&r&b and some &eLichen&r&b, I could probably start a new colony."&r
You hand the woman the Spyglass and Spectre Flares...
As you make your way through the Castle, you stumble upon a sign that reads:

&b"Buying all unused equipment. We need more &eGuards&r&b to fight the &7rising Illager forces&r&b, but to train more, we need more supplies. Either bring &6equipment for archery or for warriors to the barracks and we'll pay you handsomely&r&b."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest20: As you return to the ship, &eBottle of Spectres&r and &eLichen&r in hand, Salay waves you over.

&b"Oh wow, can't believe you actually found some. Hey, listen. Technically &5Capt'n&r&b said &6I can't spare the time to build another Spectre case&r&b. Buuuuuut, if one just so happened to show up on board, I wouldn't complain... &6Heck, I might be so suprised that I might even drop some pretty cool items...&r&b"
&b"Oh, but if I were to make one, I'd love to have one made of &eGlass&r&b with a port I could feed the &eSpectres&r&b through. Maybe some decorations too?"&r
As you return to the ship...
Build a home for the Spectres!
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest21: As you finish constructing the &eSpectre's&r cage, &5Salay&r walks up to you.
&b"Wow, this looks great! Thanks &5Wanderer&r&b! Hey, you know what? If you come back here, I'll sell you some of the &eSpectres&r&b for a pretty good price. Thanks again for your help!"&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest22: As you talk with the inhabitants of the ship, you feel it hit some turbulence, and with it, the nearest engine starts making some loud creaking noises. Everyone on board looks to a &bValkyrie&r with short red hair, dressed in overalls.

&b"What? No. No no no. It can't be breaking. I literally just fixed it. And we don't have any more supplies for it. The ship's &dGravitite core&r&b will keep us a float for a bit longer, but I don't know how long it'd last for..."&r
You walk up, and ask what is needed.

&b"What? You'd get them for me?? Heavens above, you are a godsend. I'll need &6some windmill sails, some windmill bearings, and a bunch of cogs.&r&b Oh, also I'm &5Tiana&r&b. This ship's caretaker."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest23: As you stumble aboard the nearest airship, a neighboring ship pulls up nearby. Just as the ship seems like it'll ram the one you are on, a passenger of the other ship, a dainty woman with unruly golden hair raises her hand, signalling it to stop. As the two ships run in parallel, the woman calls out to you.

&b"Greeting Wanderer! The name's &5Tress&r&b. I'm the Captain of this fleet here. I'd love to not have to yell, but without docking, we don't have a way to get across ships. &6Say, if you can figure out a way to fix that, we'll reward you.&r&b Though if not, you're still welcome. Don't go around causing trouble."&r
Figure out a way to cross ships...
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest24: As you bring back the Warped Anchors, Tress greets you.
&b"Good work! I'm a little surprised they exist, but the source I got the info from is pretty reliable"&r

&b"I am going to need you to install them. &6It'd be nice if you can make it clear where on each ship the anchor is, so it's easy to aim for.&r&b I do have some very valuable supplies I've been meaning to trade off, so I'm sure we can come to a good deal."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest25: As you hand &5Tiana&r the items for the ship's repair, she mutters a quick &b"Thank you"&r and scurries off to the underbelly of the ship. You feel a light tap on the shoulder. You see a short bald man covered in soot, googles dangling from his neck.

&b"Hope I didn't scare ya. The names &5Slobab&r&b. You'll have to excuse &5Tiana's&r&b rudeness. She's new here. The boss lady up in the clouds put her in charge of guarding this old hunka scrap, and for obvious reasons, she's eager to make a good impression."&r
&b"That said, I have to say, you whipped us those there gears real fast. Tell you what. &6Prove to me you have the true spirit of a &5Tinkerer&r&6 and I'll tell you where me old workshop lies."&r

&b"I had to flee it when I heard thee news the &5Tinkerer's Citadel&r&b was attacked, but assuming no &7Illagers&r&b got to it, you might find some nice stuff. Heck, you even seem quite strong. &6I ain't got much faith in ya, but might as well throw in a map to the &r&5Citadel&r&6 too.&b Don't go die on me, but if you took a &7Illager&r&b or two out, it'd do all us &5Tinkerers&r&b a huge favor."
You feel a tap on your shoulder...
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest26: You chuck an &eEnder Pearl&r across the gap, safely warping to the other ship. &5Tress&r stifles a small giggle, but quickly regains her composure.

&b"Nice throw. That takes quite a bit of courage. And yes, I know about &eEnder Pearls&r&b. While I'm happy to take the ones you have off your hands for emergency jumps across ships, they aren't nearly safe enough for my crew. Hate to say it, but riding the clouds ain't always the smoothest and my men don't got the best aim, if you catch my drift."
&b"That said, at our last stop, &6we hear about a device that can stabilize the teleportation of the Pearls.&r&b Find some for me, and we'll talk. I'd like at least eight, as well as fuel for them."
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest27: As you install the last &eAnchor&r, you hear an &eEnder Pearl&r break nearby and &5Tress&r appears from the &eAnchor&r.
&b"That's pretty cool! Looks like it does take a charge for every &ePearl&b though."&r

&b"My men ain't the best warriors, so it'll be hard for us to get more &ePearls&r&b. But hey, our loss is your opportunity. &6For eight anchor usages, meaning eight Ender Pearls and fuel for the Anchors, I'll sell you a Sapphire.&r&b As a mechant ship, we have a fair bit. &bBut you'll find some of our more landlocked friends will be very very excited to recieve a Sapphire."&r
Trading: Ender Pearl and Allurite for Sapphire
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest28: There are many &5villages&r and &5settlements&r spread across the land. Each will have their own questlines and rewards, though some of these are still in development. Completing these questlines will provide some great rewards and &6may even unlock new traders or other locations to explore.&r Be sure to keep an eye out!

Additionally, these quest chains may include &6quests in a diamond shape&r. These are &d"Building Quests"&r, where you may be asked to build or add something to a structure. While this isn't required, its highly recommended. These are often preceded by a &d"Gathering Quest"&r, which are &6square shaped&r. these require you to gather items, but don't require the items to be turned in.
&d&oView those that are currently implemented on the next page&r
Help the various inhabitants of this world and be rewarded!
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest29: As you walk around &5the Oasis&r, you see children desperately clawing at the sands. As they dig down, the sand becomes more damp until enough water pools. Overjoyed, the children lap it up, sand and all.
Concerned, you pull out a couple &eBottles of Water&r, offering them to the kids. They initially hesitate, but then quickly snatch them away.
&b"Thanks you kind mister!"&r they yell, as they scurry off.
As you make your way through the &5Castle&r, you stumble upon a sign that reads:

&b"Buying all unused equipment. We need more &eGuards&r&b to fight the &7rising Illager forces&r&b, but to train more, we need more supplies. Either bring &6equipment for archery or for warriors to the barracks and we'll pay you handsomely&r&b."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest30: As you come back with the map to the new Oasis, the Villagers excitedly greet you.
As you get through the cheering crowd, you hear something quietly calling you to the fountain near the village's center. As you get closer, a whispering voice seems to call out from all around you.

&d"You've done this village a great service. Do one for me as well, so I may continue my duty. Take the &6Conversion Crucible&r&d from the &eWitches of the Candy Cavities&r&d and feed it an &6Oasis Biome Candy&r&d so I may refresh my waters. Then, &6make a new fountain so I may bestow my gift onto my children.&r&d"&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest31: As you begin to leave, a woman quickly calls out to you.
&b"Sir, were you the one who gave my child water? Thank you so much!"&r

&b"The &5Oasis&r &bhas provided water to us for years and years, but the recently, the skies haven't provided us any new water and our stores are running dry. We are limited to one bottle a day and the children aren't taking it well."
&b"I worry that we've run the &5Oasis&r&b dry. &6If we could find another &5Oasis&r&b&6 nearby&r&b, maybe we could provide more water..."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest32: As you complete the new fountain, a voice resonates around you, much stronger than before.

&d"You have done me well. And so, I shall repay this debt. Bring me &6Source&r&d and I shall create &eWater&r&d for you. The &eSpring Water&r&d I make &6bears the vitality of the World, and bathing in it shall rejuvenate your soul&r&d."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest33: As you wander the &5Oasis&r, a &emerchant&r calls out to you.

&b"Good sir, thank you for the help you've offered us. We don't usually offer this, but it may be helpful in your travels. &6Here is the map to the burial grounds of the late Pharaoh.&r&b You wouldn't happen to be interested, would you?"&r
A merchant calls out to you...
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest34: As you walk around the &5Oasis&r, the scent of rotting meat hits your nose. Turning towards the scent, you see stalls of the market filled with questionable meats that the shopping &evillagers&r are vigorously bidding over.
&6Perhaps you could show them some better ways to preserve their food...&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest35: You tell the shopkeepers about salting, smoking, and chilling to preserve their food. They look at you like you are crazy, but take the items anyways.
&b"I ain't sure if these are gonna work, &5Wanderer&r&b. But we'll give it a shot."&r

&b"In the past, food here was grown and harvested in the same day. We had a &6Totem of a Flower&r&b that blessed our fields, speeding up harvests, but those days are long gone, ever since the Pharaoh passed. Some say he &6found the way to create the Totem through an Ancient Farmer&r&b, but we aint got no clue on where to find em."&r
Discover the Recipe for the Totem of Growth!
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest36: As you come back, &eTotem of Growth&r in hand, the &evillagers&r look shocked.
&b"You. Where the hell did you find that?"&r
As you explain that you made it yourself, for them, a couple &evillagers&r break down in tears of joy.
&b"Finally, our food problems are over. Thank you. Thank you so much."&r
&b"&5Wanderer&r&e, thank you for your service. We have one request though. &6Please build a greenhouse to put the totem in.&r &bWe will make it worth your time."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest37: As you walk through the &5Oasis&r, a sharply dressed merchant waves you into a dark alleyway.

&b"The name's &5Appa&r&b. Glad to finally meet the hero that saved our village. Listen, we don't offer this to everyone, but for someone as important as you, we'll allow you the privledge of browsing and buying from our wares. &6We buy and sell any sort of gemstone.&r&b I'm sure you'll find our services very, very helpful."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest38: As you finish the Greenhouse, the villagers come up to you.
&b"Thank you. If you are ever in need of food, &6we will sell it to you at a huge discount and send it to you in a heartbeat&r&b. Thank you for saving us."&r
As you walk around the Castle, you over hear some Guards:
&b"Its wonderful that my family is safe here, but the taxes are a killer."&r

&a"I know right. I've heard some &eGuards&r&6 have been taking odd jobs escorting traders and protecting bases.&a It pays pretty well, and as long as the &eKing&r&a gets his taxes, he turns a blind eye to it. I'm thinking about putting up a job posting as well. Want to join me?"&r
&b"Sure. Stopping &7Illager Patrols&r&b is decent pay, but not great."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest42: As you look around, you are amazed to see a port of &4Pirate Villagers!&r Who knew villages could be such scoundrels...
&b"Ahoy &5Matey&r&b! Come drink with me at the tavern, where the rum’s as dark as the depths and twice as dangerous!"
You approach a port of Pirates
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest43: You head into the tavern and are approached by a grizzly old man.

&b"Aye, traveler, ye’ve got that hungry gleam in yer eye. Lemme tell ye somethin’, then: out yonder in the deep brine dwell the &ethrashers&r&b—monstrous sea devils with jaws that could crack a ship’s keel like driftwood."&r
&b"Show me one of their &5teeth&r&b and the &5bones&r&b of the beast’s spine. Do that, and &eI’ll fill yer purse with gold.&r
Slay the beasts of the sea
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest44: You return to the tavern and the grizzled old man, now with a wide grin, signals you over once more.

&b"Ah, so ye survived the thrashers, eh?"&r He gives a gravelly chuckle, leaning closer, the dim tavern light catching the scar over his left eye. &b"Name’s Bartholomew, but never ye mind that. There’s a new beast I need hunted—one that stirs the nightmares of every sailor with half a mind to roam these seas."&r

&b"In the blue depths beyond lies a serpent, they say. A serpent so ancient its coils scrape the ocean floor, and its hiss can rattle the bones of dead men. Show me the &5fang of that serpent&r&b, and a &5scale from its mighty hide&r&b. With those in hand, I’ll pay ye in &b&ldiamonds and sapphires.&r

&b"Go on then, traveler,"&r Bartholomew says, his weathered grin fading to grim seriousness. &b"Ye took on thrashers—let’s see if ye’ve the courage to face the serpent that sailors dare not name aloud."&r
Slay the beasts of the sea
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest45: You return once more to the tavern. As you step inside, Bartholomew raises his mug in silent greeting and beckons you closer.

&b"So the traveler returns,"&r he growls softly, leaning in. &b"I’ve watched ye best thrashers and claim a serpent’s fang. Admirable feats, to be sure, but now I’ve another task—one that chills even my old bones."&r

&b"Out beyond the reefs lie creatures more cunning and cruel than any serpent. Sirens, they call ’em, though I reckon they’re devils in fair form. They sing tunes that wrap ‘round yer mind like chains, twistin’ yer thoughts and stealin’ yer will. A single &5tear of a siren&r&b is what I seek."&r
&b"Show me that tear and I’ll reward ye with a dark treasure few have ever laid eyes upon—the &eBlack Eye&r&b. But know this: facing a siren is no game of courage—it’s a gamble with yer very soul."&r
Bartholomew’s gaze hardens, and he nods gravely. &b"I’ve seen ye return triumphant twice. Let’s see if ye can do it thrice, traveler."&r
Slay the beasts of the sea
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest46: You return to the tavern, and the old man—Bartholomew—gives you a nod of respect this time.

&b"Back already, are ye?"&r He leans in, lowering his voice. &b"Ye’ve proven yer mettle, traveler, so let me share a secret fit for those I trust: There be creatures called &5Hippocampi&r&b out in the blue. Strange beasts, part horse, part fish, swift as the wind and loyal if treated right."&r

&b"Give ’em &5kelp.&r&b A handful or two and they'll warm to ye like an old friend. Once tamed, ye’ll find none faster across the waves, darting through foam and spray quicker than ye can blink. Makes journeyin’ ’cross the seas a breeze, I tell ye."&r
&b"Go on, traveler,"&r he says, tipping his mug in your direction. &b"With a Hippocampus at yer side, the whole watery world opens up before ye."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest47: The salty air clings to you as you step onto the rickety docks, noticing a pirate captain eyeing you from beneath his tattered hat.

He beckons you closer and growls, &b"Listen up, sailor. My ship, the &4Black Siren&r&b, sets sail soon, and I need &5cannon balls&r&b—hand-forged iron shot that can crack a schooner in half." He taps his boot impatiently on the boards, &b"Craft me a set of those beauties, and I’ll reward ye with a pouch of emeralds.&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest48: You return to the docks, and find the captain waiting, and speaks in a lower tone:

&b"Ye did well with those cannon balls, sailor. Now let’s get something straight—my name’s &6Captain Mayo&r&b, and if ye want to sail on the &4Black Siren&r&b, ye’ll need to prove yer worth."&r He tilts his head toward the bustling tavern at the pier’s end, where drunken laughter roars. &b"Inside that den of scoundrels lie 15 &6iron goblets&r&b, that I fancy addin’ to my stash. Slip in, snatch ’em out from under their noses, and bring ’em back to me—quiet as a whisper, no fuss, no alarm."&r
Captain Mayo’s eyes gleam as he crosses his arms. &b"Show me ye’ve got the nerve and the cunning for this, and ye’ll have a place among my crew."&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest49: You find Captain Mayo at the bow of the &4Black Siren&r&b, his eyes fixed on distant waters. He turns, the scar on his cheek catching the lanternlight.

&b"Ye’ve proven yer mettle, but now we face foes no mere blade can tame,"&r he says, voice low. &b"Other pirates lurk on these seas, and beasts beneath the waves answer only to Davy Jones’ call. Craft me &5silver bombs&r&b and build a &5combustion table&r&b so we can strike hard and strike first."&r He grips your shoulder, a grin breaking across his weathered face. &b"Earn this, and I’ll let ye chart the course we sail at dawn."&r
Having seen the job posting on the Bulletin Board, you approach the &5Captain of the Guard&r, intending to offer your services.
You make your proposal and he takes a quick look at you, then scoffs.
&b"You can't be serious. Scram kid, we ain't desperate enough to take vagrants like yourself. Ain't trustworthy. Plus, you barely look like you know your way around a sword."&r
&b"What? Still here? Fine. &6Prove your worth, then we'll talk.&r&b"&r
Join the Royal Guard: Proving your Worth
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest50: You find Captain Mayo leaning against a crate on the dock, a familiar smirk tugging at his lips.

&b"Back again, are ye?"&r he says, voice warm with a hint of fondness. &b"We’ve sailed through storms, faced other pirates, and survived beasts that’d make lesser souls weep. Now I’ve a simpler proposition for ye."&r He taps a pile of &egold ingots&r&b stacked neatly at his side.

&b"Bring me one of those &5silver bombs&r&b ye forged. I’ve got use for ’em, and ye know I got loads of gold. Trade me a bomb, and this &egold&r&b is yours—no riddles, no trials this time, just good, honest pay for a friend of the &4Black Siren.&r
ftbquests.chapter.village_quests.quest51: As you look around, you see a land of &abright green&r dotted with houses inside of &2moss-covered mounds&r.
And under their grassy roofs, &6friendly voices hum with quiet stories told to crickets and the creeping dusk.&r
